title.narrative: Energy Access for Afram Plains South, through Tuatara Group, LLC

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to the Ministry of Energy in Ghana will fund a feasibility study to determine the viability of building minigrids to support energy access for more than 50 unelectrified communities in the Afram Plains South District in Ghana. The Study is expected to help Ghana reach its goal of universal energy access by 2020 and will open a new market for U.S. minigrid suppliers. A USTDA grant to the Ministry of Finance of Ghana, acting through the Ministry of Energy of Ghana, will fund a feasibility study to determine the viability of building minigrids to support energy access for more than 50 unelectrified communities in the Afram Plains South District in Ghana. The Study is expected to help Ghana reach its goal of universal energy access by 2020 and will open a new market for U.S. minigrid suppliers.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Solar Power for Six Diocese, through AEG International

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to the Ghanaian solar company Strategic Power Solutions will fund a feasibility study to transition six dioceses of the Ghanaian Catholic Church to solar power. These six dioceses support over 600 buildings comprised of schools, hospitals and other facilities, and transitioning them to solar power will allow these facilities to run on renewable energy, lower their energy costs, and provide more reliable energy. It will also create an opportunity for U.S. companies to provide goods, services, and expertise.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Solar Power for Six Diocese, through AEG International

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to the Ghanaian solar company Strategic Power Solutions will fund a feasibility study to transition six dioceses of the Ghanaian Catholic Church to solar power. These six dioceses support over 600 buildings comprised of schools, hospitals and other facilities, and transitioning them to solar power will allow these facilities to run on renewable energy, lower their energy costs, and provide more reliable energy. It will also create an opportunity for U.S. companies to provide goods, services, and expertise. The Grantee has selected AEG International of Charlotte, North Carolina to perform the Study and help implement the Project.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Aerojet Maintenance, Repair, and Overhaul Facility Project, through Alton Aviation Consultancy LLC

description.narrative: This USTDA grant to Aerojet Aviation Limited funds a feasibility study to support the deployment of a maintenance, repair, and overhaul (MRO) facility at the Kotoka International Airport in Ghana (Project). The Project has the potential to promote the use of U.S. technology with the potential for U.S. exports of goods and services over the first ten years of operation. Implementation of the Project would establish the first full-service MRO facility in West Africa, boosting regional economic growth and increasing safety, security, and regional mobility. U.S. company Alton Aviation Consultancy LLC was chosen to complete the Study.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Cold Chain Facilities Network Feasibility Study, through Global Cold Chain Alliance

description.narrative: This USTDA grant to FreezeLink 3PL Limited funds a feasibility study to assess the deployment of a temperature-controlled logistics network consisting of multiple storage facilities and services within Ghana. The network would likely consist of facilities at the major port of Tema and the largest Ghanaian cities, as well as mid and smaller sized cities. The envisioned cold chain network will facilitate the storage of imported and locally-produced refrigerated and frozen agricultural commodities, including meats, fruits, and vegetables, with a significant focus on poultry broiler meat. The U.S. company World Food Logistics Organization has been selected to carry out the Study on a sole-source basis.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - ECG Smart Grid Applications, through Government of Ghana

description.narrative: This $646,000 feasibility study grant supports the technical, financial, environmental, and other critical aspects of a Smart Grid Applications project for the Electricity Company of Ghana Limited (ECG). The feasibility study is developing the planning and technical design aspects of a high-level distribution systems integration strategy and recommending a system that will address ECGs business process planning and decision-making, and fully integrate the companys distribution management. In addition, the study includes training that will build the capacity of ECG's staff to implement the feasibility studys recommendations.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Eastern Transmission Line, through Government of Ghana

description.narrative: This feasibility study provided Ghana Grid Company Limited, Ghana's power transmission operator, an assessment of the technical and economic viability of the construction of a new power transmission line between Aiekpe and Kpandu, and a new power transmission line between Kadjebi and Yendi. The construction of these lines would complete a circuit around Lake Volta and bring electricity to rural areas in the northern and eastern regions of Ghana.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Floating LNG Storage and Regasification Unit, through Global Marketing & Communications, Inc.

description.narrative: This $295,000 Ghana Floating Liquefied Natural Gas Storage and Regasification Unit (FSRU) Reverse Trade Mission provided an environment for Ghana's FSRU stakeholders to (1) deepen their understanding of FSRU technologies and project implementation; (2) identify potential safety and security procedures and technologies to ensure the safe deployment and operation of the FSRU; and (3) meet U.S. technical experts that could help the Ghanaians assess the optimal positioning and offshore location of the proposed FSRU.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Branchless Banking, through Government of Ghana

description.narrative: This technical assistance (TA) is supporting the Ghana Interbank Payment and Settlement System in determining the ideal business and operational models to support the further deployment of electronic payment infrastructure in Ghana. The TA is also providing recommendations on information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure required to enable electronic financial transactions in Ghana.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - NEDCo Management and Investment Planning, through Government of Ghana

description.narrative: This $410,000 technical assistance (TA) supports the Northern Electricity Distribution Company (NEDCo) in restructuring its business operations and prioritizing its investments. In particular, the TA is assisting NEDCo in developing a five-year investment plan, which will identify necessary procurements in areas related to demand side management, load management, and network operations, control, and management. The TA also includes training that will build the capacity of NEDCos staff to implement the TAs recommendations.

title.narrative: Buipe Solar 20 Mw Solar Power Plant, through U.S. Government - Trade and Development Agency

description.narrative: This grant to Buipe Solar Ltd. will fund a feasibility study ("Study") to determine the viability of a 20 megawatt solar photovoltaic project in northern Ghana. The project represents one of the first commercial-scale solar plants and the first competitively-bid energy projects in Ghana. The Study will help to increase the market opportunities for U.S. companies and support Ghana to produce affordable, clean energy to meet its existing and growing energy demand. WSP|Parsons Brinckerhoff (New York, NY) is the sole source contractor implementing the Study.

title.narrative: Biomass to Power, through Recast Energy LLC

description.narrative: A USTDA grant Village Corps Ghana Limited partially funds a feasibility study to assess the viability of a proposed twenty megawatt power plant just north of Nsawam, in the Eastern Region of Ghana, fueled with a mix of cultivated giant bamboo and existing biomass resources. The feasibility study is performed on a sole source basis by the U.S. firm, Recast Energy, LLC.
